label: Advanced Community Projects
description: Advanced discussion and practicum on principles of psychology which may supplement mental health and other human services in a community. Students serve as nonprofessional mental health workers in supervised experiences in school hospitals and other nontraditional settings. May be repeated in the same or subsequent terms to a maximum of 8 undergraduate hours. Prerequisite: PSYC 340 and consent of instructor.
courseSectionInformation: May be repeated in the same or subsequent terms to a maximum of 8 undergraduate hours. Prerequisite: PSYC 340 and consent of instructor.
classScheduleInformation: A two-semester commitment is required. To apply please attend the orientations held in late March and early April for the following academic year. Contact the instructor for more information or visit the Psychology website: http://www.psychology.illinois.edu/undergraduate/current/opportunities/departmental/CommunityProjects.html
